content: Hey @Sean , do you know if the old src/adrt executables still work and are used for anything?
At a glance through the history most of the work since circa 2016 (and possibly well before that) is build fixes or code refactoring...

the adrt gui interface was fairly customized for a specific project, iirc... it'd be cool if it were used for stuff since, but I suspect it was dependent on a resident expert driving? the core, libtie, was included into librt, so the kernel lives on

They do still work. I'd keep them around at least until we get ibrt up and running. I've been meaning to brush off the path tracer in particular as its quality and ease of use was pretty great for making a quick visual. If we get stalled on art, that will probably be the fallback.
The GUI should get merged into the shotline selection tool interface. That's something Nick was working on but didn't get there before he left.
